Name: Warhammer: Invasion – Realm of the Phoenix King
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The glorious city of Lothern prepares for war, the High Elves ever vigilant of their borders. Woe to any enemy who invades the realm of the powerful Phoenix King...

Realm of the Phoenix King is the second Battle Pack in The Capital Cycle for Warhammer: Invasion. With half of its 60 cards (three copies each of 20 unique cards) devoted to the ancient and powerful defenders of Ulthuan, Realm of the Phoenix King is an invaluable Battle Pack for players of the High Elf faction. Additionally, players of other factions will find a variety of useful tactics, units, and support options.

The Empire's most gifted engineers bring the mighty Clockwork Horse to the battlefield, while the Dark Elves' Spawn of Kintearer strikes fear into the hearts of his foes. Meanwhile, thousands of Skavenslaves serve as shock troops for the verminous horde, and the Wood Elves' Stag of the Sacred Glade charges forth from the forest, barreling through enemy defenses!
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Warhammer Invasion – Living Card Game

Name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Curse of the Jade Emperor Asylum Pack
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The Great Old Ones' insidious reach continues to spread and Curse of the Jade Emperor, the second Asylum Pack of the Ancient Relics cycle, follows the tendrils of evil into the Far East. Prepare for restless dead, secret societies, and unholy artifacts!

Ancient Relics is based on the theme of the global influence of the Ancient Ones and their cults and moves the action from H.P. Lovecraft's dread-filled New England to the wider world. In Curse of the Jade Emperor players will find exotic, yet hauntingly familiar characters and tales, pulled from the myths and legends of ancient China. The Middle Kingdom's undying past collides with a present made all the more uncertain through the interference of diverse otherworldly actors.

The pull of China is strong and in Call of Cthulhu it attracts academics from Miskatonic University, eager to study the history and artifacts of one of the world's oldest civilizations. The forces of law and order also come to do battle with some of the world's deadliest criminal organizations. Curse of the Jade Emperor also follows Ancient Relics' over-arching theme of artifacts with great and terrible power reoccurring throughout history. Pack your bags for a voyage to the Orient in Curse of the Jade Emperor!
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Call of Cthulhu – The Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Conspiracies of Chaos Asylum Pack
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Secrets and mysteries abound in a classic Asylum Pack, which is emerging from the shadows to crawl back into the light. Conspiracies of Chaos, the fifth Asylum Pack in the Forgotten Lore cycle of expansions for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game, returns!

Conspiracies of Chaos reintroduces to the Living Card Game environment this intriguing Asylum Pack, updated to the 60-card per pack format (three copies each of 20 unique cards). The included cards have been updated to incorporate the most recent FAQ. In addition, the text on a number of cards has been altered from its original printing, adjusting for game balance and rules clarity.

Among Conspiracies of Chaos' features are six faction-specific conspiracies. Conspiracies are story cards that players can play from their own decks and win to further their goal of claiming three stories. The six conspiracies included within Conspiracies of Chaos play into one of each faction’s particular strengths. Also featured are an assortment of characters that thrive in a world of conspiracy–characters that grow stronger when a conspiracy is in play. In addition, this Asylum Pack also includes support cards and events that can wildly alter the tempo of the game.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Call of Cthulhu – The Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Dunwich Denizens Asylum Pack
Description:
Game description from the publisher:

Lunatic Sorcerors and the grotesque abomination the Dunwich Horror stalk the lonely hillsides of rural New England and the forbidden libraries of Miskatonic University. Dunwich Denizens is the sixth and final classic Asylum Pack of the "Forgotten Lore" cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game.

Based on "The Dunwich Horror", Dunwich Denizens brings to your tabletop the abandoned farms, mist-shrouded hillsides, and eerie characters of one of Lovecraft's most chilling works of horror fiction. It reintroduces three copies each of 20 different classic cards to Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game and incorporates the most recent errata. The sleepy hamlet of Dunwich hides horrors beyond imagination. Guard your sanity!

Game description from back of the pack:

"They walk unseen and foul in lonely places where the Words have been spoken and the Rites howled through at their Seasons."
- H.P. Lovecraft

Dunwich Denizens is a supplemental set of 60 fixed cards for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game.  It contains 20 different cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.

CONTAINS CARDS 61-80 of "THE FORGOTTEN CYCLE LORE CYCLE."

This is not a standalone deck; you must have additional Call of Cthulhu LCG cards to play.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Call of Cthulhu – The Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Turtle Soup
Description:
A press-your-luck game of fraught cuisine for the Decktet.

Flip a card face up and then flip another. Continue until there are cards showing four or more of the six Decktet suits.

Active players simultaneously indicate whether they intend to take a bowl now or wait for more ingredients.

If the additional card makes it so that the face up cards include at least one instance of each of the six Decktet suits, then the soup has gone Turtle Butt. The soup night is over. Return any chips in the pot to the bank. Players who didn't take a bowl get nothing for that night.

The game should be played for at least five soup nights. Obviously, you can make the game longer by playing more nights. In the end, each small chip collected is worth 1 point and each large chip is worth 5. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Ziggurat Demolition Throwdown
Description:
Because the world needs more games about dueling wizards.

You are an ancient and powerful wizard living in a community for aged but powerful wizards. The guy across the way bubbles his cauldron much too loud, even though you have asked him to turn it down several times. There was a time when those who disturbed your afternoon tea would feel the force of your eldritch wrath. Perhaps this afternoon will be such a time.

The uses a copy of the Decktet and one Rainbow Pyramid stash for each player. (That's a small, medium, and large pyramid in each of five colours: Red, Yellow, Green, Blue, and Black. Two players can play with an Ice Dice set or two Treehouse sets.) Cards represent spells you have in mind; in the game, this means attacks you can make. Pyramids are your circle of magical instruments; they are what you need to have in place to play cards. Your opponent will whittle away at your pyramids, and you at theirs. The first player to run out of pyramids loses.

Name: Witte Gij't Nou Nóg Nie?
Description:
An expansion for the game Witte Gij't?.

This expansion has more detailed questions about the Dutch province of Noord-Brabant (NB). There is also a new category about guessing a famous person from the province without saying some prohibited words - replacing the Interview category.

The set consists of 54 cards and can be played with or without the base-game.

Name: Who is The Doctor?: Demon's Run Standoff
Description:
‘Demons run when a good man goes to war.’
This is an unauthorised, non-profit, print-and-play game inspired by the BBC TV show Doctor Who episode ‘A Good Man Goes to War’ (Series 6, Episode 7). The basic game mechanism is a kind of reverse werewolf/mafia game where the secret character, The Doctor, is the only person who can’t kill anyone and has to survive on wits and confusion alone.

Background: (Or buy the DVD and watch it!)
Human soldiers and the mysterious headless monks are working together in an uneasy alliance. They have kidnapped The Doctor’s companion (Amy Pond) and taken her to the asteroid know a Demon’s Run. The Doctor arrives on the asteroid disguised as one of the monks but reveals himself and demands Amy’s return. The lights go out and then back on, all orchestrated by the doctor, of course. Now the soldiers are stood there facing the monks. The soldiers know that one of the monks is their feared enemy, The Doctor, determined to foil their plans. All they have to do is to work out which monk is The Doctor in disguise and shoot him before he escapes. But if they shoot the wrong monk they will feel the wrath of their allies and be killed themselves by the monks dying blast. The monks themselves know that the soldiers are trigger happy and might shoot them. It might be best for them to zap any of the trigger happy soldiers before they themselves are killed - at least the other soldiers would know that they were a monk and not The Doctor. But the monks’ plan needs the soldiers and if they lose all of their soldiers then their plans will fail and The Doctor will triumph. The soldiers and monks need to act quickly before The Doctor is able to escape. The scene is set for the Demon’s Run Standoff.

The Game:
The players take on the role of soldiers, headless monks and The Doctor through a series of standoffs. During each standoff: the soldiers try to kill The Doctor; the monks try to direct the soldiers to The Doctor, and The Doctor just tries to survive. At the end of the standoff, points are given to players whose characters are still alive.

Name: The "Trivia" Game of Sheboygan, Wisconsin
Description:
This game was made as a fundraiser for the Accents of Sheboygan, a color guard team. The spaces on the board are business sponsors or lists of individual sponsors, featuring such historical local classics as Zurheide's Ice Cream and Prange's, neither of which still exist. The trivia cards are a mix of general trivia and Sheboygan history.

Roll the dice and move. The first to answer 12 questions correctly gets to try to answer a question from the Jackpot. The first to answer a question from the Jackpot wins.

Name: Flames of War: Tropic Lightning – Armoured and Airborne Combat in Vietnam 1965-1971
Description:
Free with Wargames Illustrated 282 (april 2011)

Tropic Lightning is a 40-page book covering Tropic Lightning: Armoured and Airborne Combat in Vietnam 1965-1971. Adding tanks, armoured cavalry and mechanised infantry for the Americans and some more heavy weapons and RPG-7 rocket launchers for the Vietnamese and two new missions.

Inside You Will Find:

     Rules for using Flames Of War to refight the battles between American airmobile and armoured forces and the People’s Army of Vietnam (or the North Vietnamese Army as the Americans called it).
     Field a Tank Company equipped with powerful M48 Patton tanks firing ‘beehive’ ammunition.
     Mount up and move out with an Armored Cavalry Troop packed with M113 ACAV assault vehicles and M48 and M551 Sheridan tanks.
     Lead a Rifle Company (Mech) in M113 armoured personnel carriers on a Search and Destroy mission.
     Strike from the skies with a Rifle Company (Airmobile) mounted in UH-1D ‘Slick’ helicopters.
     Ambush the Americans at the head of a Tiá»ƒu Äoàn Bá»™ Binh Infantry Battalion.
     Inspirational colour photographs.

Name: Deadlands: Invasion of Slaughter Gulch
Description:
Things have gone from bad to worse in Slaughter Gulch.

Our once quiet little town has already been overrun once. Since they discovered the ghost rock there has been a constant struggle for control of the town. Unfortunately, it seems the mining has also attracted something else...Something EVIL!
 Deadlands: Invasion of Slaughter Gulch adds new elements to the board game of Weird West fun!
 Invasion of Slaughter Gulch adds:
New Monster Event cards
New Encounter cards
New Items 
New and expanded rules

And a new card type: Hired Guns

Requires Deadlands: the Battle for Slaughter Gulch to play

Name: Keel-Hauled!
Description:
Keel-Hauled! is a dice game for 2 to 4 players.  Although the game does contain some complexity, it is relatively simple to learn.  Play time for a full game of 50 points is usually less than an hour.

Players are pirates who vie for the position of Captain on a pirate ship.  To to this, players must roll their dice to assemble sets that first match the number on the "Crew Dice" which represent the Cabin Boy, Ship's Cook, and First Mate.  This becomes more challenging as there are limited spaces on the boat for dice sets to be placed, and the first player can change throughout the game.

The game is normally continued until one player scores 30 to 50 points, when the player with the most points overall is dubbed the new Captain of the ship.

Keel-Hauled has been discontinued, and is no longer available at The Game Crafter website.

Name: Big Boss
Description:
Played similar with UNO.
The aim is to empty your hand of all cards. When playing with 2 players deal 7 cards each. When with 3 or more deal 6 cards each. The remaining stack of cards are placed in front of the players face down and the top card is them turned over and placed next to the stack.
There are plenty of special cards in this game:
When a "Pick 2"or "Pick 5" card is played, the next player must draw 2or 5 cards or play another 2 card,
"Skip Turn" skips turn.
"Bullet Proof" card blocks any skip or pick card.

Contents:

     52 cards

Name: Mob Boss
Description: Shuffle deck. Deal out to each player one card at a time until all cards are dealt out. Each player checks their cards and discards all pairs. The player to the left of dealer offers their hand to the player on their left hiding cards from their view. That player then takes one card from the hand. Again, any pairs are discarded. Playing continues. "The Boss" card can be passed around several times. The object is to be left with "The Boss" card. Finally, when all pairs are laid down, there will be one person left with "The Boss" card. That person is "Boss of ‘The Family’".

Name: If Badger was a Bunny
Description:
The hare and tortoise are staging a series of races!  This an asymmetric 2 player climbing race game using the Decktet system.  Even though the players must shed the same amount of cards, the Hare is given much more to use (and is more free to use them) at the start of the game, but the Tortoise will slowly and steadily build up her hand.

The card play like climbing games is in response to the opponent's plays, but it is also constrained because the players must always connect their plays with their developing race tracks.  The winner with the best record after four races is the champion badger!

Full rules may be found on wiki.decktet.com

Name: Sicher ans Ziel
Description:
Pass safely through the traffic! Policeman Paul help players: There are many different picture cards to for close examination. Whoever assesses the traffic situation correctly will move ahead. Traffic lights, zebra crossings, footpaths and road game - this game teaches children how to behave in traffic and gain independence.

---

German Box Back
Sicher durch den Verkehr! Polizist Paul hilft spielerisch dabei: Viele verschiedene Bildkarten regen zum genauen Hinsehen an. Wer die Verkehrs-Situationen richtig einschätzt, kommt gut voran. Ampel, Zebrastreifen, Fußweg und Spielstraße - mit diesem Spiel lernen Kinder das richtige Verhalten im Verkehr und gewinnen an Selbstständigkeit

Name: Quick Quest
Description:
Quick Quest distills dungeon delving into its basic elements: killing monsters and looting treasure. Level up you heroes, equip your items, and venture deeper into the dungeon. Can your party survive to level 10? If they do there's a nasty boss and evil minions waiting there for you.

Designed for solo play but easily adapted to multiplayer, Quick Quest is a fast-paced fantasy card and dice game that only takes about 30 minutes to play.

You might not always have time enough for an RPG but there's always time for a Quick Quest.

Includes:
Hero Cards Deck (8 cards)
Treasure Deck (43 cards)
Quest Treasure Deck (17 cards)
Monster Deck (68 cards)
Quick Quest Rules Document
1 D12 (17mm) - Random Color
2 D6 (16mm) - Black
2 D6 (16mm) - Blue
2 D6 (16mm) - Red
3 D6 (16mm) - White
2 D6 (16mm) - Yellow
25 Poker Chips (22mm) - Red

Name: Les cinq Dalton
Description:
The batlle continues between the lonesome cowboy and the most notorious outlaws in the West. This game is a battle of wits, with Lucky Luke and his faithful steed Jolly Jumper on one side, and the Dalton brothers and Ma Dalton on the other.

The game consists of a plastic board, 8 squares by 8, on which are placed 64 counters. The orange counters represent Lucky Luke and  Jolly Jumper. The purple counters the Dalton brothers and Ma Dalton.

Rules: the game is for 2 players. The aim is to get 5 counters in a row (4 Lucky Luke + Jolly Jumper or 4 Daltons + Ma Dalton)
Each player puts down one counter at a time, and his opponent must try to stop him making a line, ath the same time gaining points himself. each complete line is worth 1 point, and the player with the highest number of points is the winner

Name: Jerusalem: The Builder
Description:
The Builder is a new Action card for Jerusalem.

Just add the card to the basic Action card deck to play with it.

If you play this card, you spend two Bezant coins to the Bank and receive 3 Prestige points.

Name: Jerusalem: The Assassin
Description:
The Assassin is a new Action card for Jerusalem.

Just add the card to the basic Action card deck to play with it.

If you play this card, you spend two Bezant coins and you can kill one Squire to an opponent even if it's protected by a Baron. The dead Squire goes back to general reserve.

Name: Derelicts of Sin: Heresy
Description:
Derelicts of Sin: Heresy is the first in a series of games revolving around the Derelicts of Sin and the dark past of the Theocratic Council.

Heresy revolves around Kyle Mason, the sole survivor of a terrible act of sabotage.  Hoping to find oxygen before he asphyxiates, Kyle limps his sabotaged ship into a forbidden Cursed Zone called "the Wreckage."  There, he boards one of the Derelicts of Sin, the Heresy, desperate to find the supplies he needs to survive and return home.

This solo game seeks to recreate the feel of classic text-based adventures.  The player takes on the role of engineer Kyle Mason.  Oxygen is used as action points to move, open locked doors, restore power, etc.  The player begins on the Airlock tile.  As he or she explores the ship, additional tiles are drawn randomly and added to the ship.  These tiles provide instructions on how to further advance, reveal the items that can be found in the new room, and detail the the puzzle(s), if any, that must be solved in order to win the game.

In the current version, a player sheet is used to track the player's physical and mental states (which affect the player's ability to search the ship and perform various actions), as well as the player's oxygen level and inventory.  Another optional version is in development that will use chart tiles and tokens to track these things.

As the player explores the ship, he or she will find data cards that gradually reveal the terrible fate of the Heresy and its passengers and crew.  They also provide victory points that are key to obtaining the specific ending a player desires.  Without sufficient victory points, players will lose when they end the game, so it's important to find as many data cards as possible.

This game was developed as part of the  Solitaire Print-and-Play Contest at http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/644090/solitaire-print-and-play-contest/page/1.

Name: Air-musement Park
Description:
In Air-musement Park the ride through the amusement park can be played alone or with others. Single players can work through each maze to improve their skills and improve their time.  With multiple players, time each player's attempt and the player with the best time wins! If the player loses air control of the ball, the player must start over. Players can physically move around
each maze as they manipulate the ball through each challenge run; however, the player can not touch or move the maze itself.

Name: Color Connection Maze
Description:
Game where math skills, color blending, critical thinking and fast-paced, finger-flicking fun meet.

This intriguing game is a fun way for children to explore combinations and blends of colors. For example, by shifting the yellow and blue levers, they guide a marble into the green slot.  By shifting the red, yellow and white levers, they guide a marble into the peach slot. To win, all slots must be filled with two marbles of matching colors. It's a great test of visual tracking, mental aerobics and hand-eye coordination.

Contents:

     1 Plastic game board


(with 32 marbles, 2 plastic legs
and wind-up timer)

Name: Munchkin 4.5
Description: It is the Italian version of The Wicked Munchkin Die that besides the D10 Wicked Dice and the Bag includes 20 cards in Italian. Part of the cards are translation of promo cards and partly unique Italian cards like the Maledition "Tretatre Trentini".

Name: Green Gators
Description:
This silly word game includes 80 game cards. Players take turns describing the object (noun) on each card without saying the word on the card. The first person that guesses the correct word wins the card. When a player gets a card with a green alligator they give clues to the other players to help them guess the activity (verb) the alligator is doing. The person who correctly
guesses the most cards wins.

Name: Pool Party
Description:
The object of Pool Party game is to be the first player to bring their frogs (disks) into a row, starting from the smaller inner circle next to the island and continuing in a straight line out to the largest circle is the winner.  Which frolicking frog will be first to hop in and form a row in the pool?  Only the dice can say.  This suspenseful game encourages kids to call on their thinking, basic math and social skills.

Contents:

     1 Game board
     30 Frogs (disks)


(Each disk size is in 6 colors: red, blue, green, purple, orange, yellow)
5 Large disks (1-3/16")
5 Semi-large disks (1-1/16")
5 Medium disks (7/8")
5 Semi-medium disks (13/16")
5 Small disks (19/32")

     2 Standard 6-sided dice

Name: What's Different? Matching game
Description:
Look carefully!  These images are very similar and as players match picture cards to them they develop concentration, observation, and critical thinking skills. Players match the picture cards with the pictures on their boards. The quickest player is the winner.

Contents:

     4 Game boards


1 Balls game board
1 Cat game board
1 Clown game board
1 Tomato game board

     36 Lotto picture cards


9 Balls lotto cards
9 Cat lotto cards
9 Clown lotto cards
9 Tomato lotto cards

     1 Check sheet

Name: Crayolino
Description:
Unique charade card game where the players have to throw a dice and then depending of the number that comes up have the possibility to have drawn the same amount of pictures to figure out whats on the other players card.
The dice rolls... and it is a «2»! The player has the right to 2 drawings in order to make you guess by association of ideas, the object drawn on his card.

Contents:

     100 cards featuring 600 objects in all, 
     5 pads of paper, 
     5 pencils
     2 special dice.

Name: Boa
Description: The player throws the 3 dices . If he obtains the combination "B.O.A" he wins cards to enlarge his snake. The largest Boa wins

Name: Fosfofou
Description:
A luminous observation game: The cards all look the same at first glance, so it's not so easy to pair them up.

Object of the game is create as many pairs as You can. Players mix the cards then place them on the table with the "5 geometric forms" side facing upwards. All the players play at the same time. Once the signal is given, each player looks at the cards and tries to find identical pairs. As soon as a player thinks he has created a pair, he takes two cards, places them in front of him and continues to search for other pairs. But watch out for mistakes as the cards are very similar!In fact, all the cards contain the 5 same geometric shapes; only their location differs from one card to the other. You are not allowed to touch the cards except to finally take them!

Game ends when there are no more cards in the centre of the table, or it does not seem possible to create another pair (if the players have taken incorrect pairs), each player checks the pairs that he has created. Winner is the player with the most correct pairs.

Components:

     48 luminous cards

Name: Zed by Dawn
Description:
The world as you knew it has collapsed, flesh eating horrors from your worst nightmares walk the earth, and you're low on ammo..

Welcome to Zed by Dawn.

Object:
Zed by Dawn is a print-and-play solo survival horror dice and card game in the world of Zed Run!!! Before the Citystates, before the Gameshow, there were survivors that tirelessly fought the undead hordes; ZbD pits you against a world gone mad.

Zbd's Combat system requires the player to meet or exceed a number of successes that match the encounters target number, using a custom set of six-sided dice.

Each roll whether it be all six dice or just one die will use the survivors precious resources, Fatigue is use to perform melee attacks, ammo is used to perform ranged attacks and if your survivor is ever out of these resources, they cannot use the matching weapon.

Weapons will lower the needed number of successes to defeat encounters.

Items will be used to replenish your survivors resource pools.

Events encountered will hinder your advancement.

Survive to draw the last card in the ZbD deck and made it through the night. But what will tomorrow bring.

You must manage your resources, acquire supplies, and defeat an endless army of the walking dead; your only goal is to survive.

What you need to play
72 ZbD Cards
6   Survivor Cards
3   Resource Tracking dice (d20)
6   Combat dice (d6)

Name: Pirate Polo
Description: Pirate Polo is a frantic live-action game for 2 - 4 "pirates". The game is played using a mini-trampoline as the playing surface. Each player has 5 dice of a single, unique color. In the center of the mini-trampoline is set a heavy, non-fragile cereal bowl. The players space themselves evenly around the mini-trampoline and place all five of their dice on the game surface in front of them. Each player has a polo mallet (at times also known as a serving spoon). On the starting signal, all players strike underneath the mini-trampoline with their polo mallet to try to propel their dice into the bowl. The first player to get all 5 dice in the bowl is the winner. This game is an alternative to the difficult to obtain Piratenbillard.

Name: GeoSafari World Challenge
Description:
This electronic talking quiz game challenges kids with fast-paced high tech fun! High quality digital Texas Instruments voice technology asks questions about world countries, rivers, mountains, landmarks and more. Over 7,500 intriguing questions!  Unit updates scores and provides positive reinforcement.

Contents:

     1 Electronic game unit features four light-up Play buttons for one to four players. Unit updates scores and provides positive reinforcement.

Name: Academe
Description:
Academe is a quick, cooperative, filler card game for 3 players: one Thinker, one Teacher and one Builder.  The players must expend and earn Ideas, Knowledge and Material by building inventions.  Possible inventions are determined by turning over cards in rounds, and the player must choose which invention to build in each turn.  If, by the end of the three rounds of the game, the team has earned enough of these three commodities to build a University, they win the game.

Because it is non-competitive, it can also be easily played by fewer than 3 people, if one player wants to play more than one character.  In addition, the commodity targets can be lowered to make the game easy to win, for young children.

Name: MiYu Magic Card Game
Description:
A card game based on the popular game MiYu.

Players collect elements of a magic circles by discarding sets of 3 cards. A set is made of 1 (out of 4) element, a Zodiac sign associated to that element and the corresponding stone.

The game includes joker cards that, when rubbed by a player, reveal a message as by magic!

Name: Roll and Score Bingo
Description:
Players roll 2 dice and try to match the sum of the dice in his bingo sheet (numbers 2-12). Player who fills his sheet first is the winner

Contents:

     score pad, 
     2 dice, 
     cup

Name: Snag
Description: Players compete to accumulate the most tiles using a combination of memory, alertness and luck. When a 'Run' of 4 tiles in a row appears, the first to yell 'Snag!' is entitled to place them in his winnings pile. Players maneuver 80 wooden pieces on the board. Object of the game is outwit and outguess the opponents.

Name: Munchkin 10th Anniversary Shot Glass
Description:
Publisher's BlurbMunchkin is not a drinking game. Really.

But don't let that stop you from showing your love of Munchkin with the Munchkin 10th Anniversary Shot Glass. These 1.5 oz glasses are black with the Munchkin 10th Anniversary logo in gold. It's a treasure that any munchkin would be happy to find in his dungeon haul... especially since they come with a special rule.

Munchkin 10th Anniversary Shot Glass Rule

The Munchkin 10th Anniversary Shot Glass may be used in any Munchkin game or its sequels.

When fighting a monster on your turn, you may take one complete shot of Strength Potion* from the Munchkin 10th Anniversary Shot Glass to get a +10 combat bonus. You may do this as many times as you like during a game, but every drink of Strength Potion after the first costs you a level. You may only benefit from one Strength Potion per combat.


     The owner of the Shot Glass is the sole judge of what liquid(s) will make up the Strength Potion.


				
				
					OtherPart of the Munchkin series

Name: Red Baron
Description:
Red Baron is a low complexity, quick playing board game of World War I air combat. This is not an aerial combat simulation by any means. It is a relatively simple "beer & pretzels" game in which the players use cards to fly their fighters, bombers, and balloons.

The game is two-dimensional (no altitude considerations) and features three aircraft types (fighters, bombers and balloons). Players use cards to maneuver their aircraft (one per card play) with the aim of collecting victory points by shooting down enemy aircraft, bombing ground targets (with bombers) or conducting aerial observation over no man's land (with balloons). The players each start with six aircraft but can vary the assortment in an effort to pursue differing victory strategies.

The game comes packaged in a ziploc bag that contains the 11" by 17" card-stock (unmounted) board, 38  playing pieces (counters), 28 cards and 4 pages of rules.

Name: The Battle for Cyprus: 1941
Description:
"The Battle for Cyprus - 1941" is an expansion for Air Assault on Crete and depicts the proposed plan for a German airborne assault on the island of Cyprus in mid-1941.

This wargame uses the rules from Air Assault on Crete with variations and expansions. This expansion was original published in Avalon Hill The GENERAL Vol.18,No.3magazine. The map was included as an insert to the magazine and mounted counters were available via mail order from Avalon Hill.

Name: Wildcard Football
Description:
This football strategy game revolves around a pair of selector cups, one for each player. The cups are built into the thick gridiron board and function as dials that determine the play selected by each coach.

The outcome of each offensive play is determined by die rolls in the selector cups. The offensive team rolls for yardage gained. The defensive player rolls two dice that can generate random events like a fumble or a penalty.

Play follows the rules of football with punts, field goals, and every other element of the sport.

The board includes a sliding football marker and a matching first down marker that also slides up and down the field. There is a huge scoreboard plus the rulebook.

Published in 1978 by Wildcard, Inc.

Name: TT Races
Description:
This is a simple roll and move game of the TT Races on the Isle of Man.  The players take turns rolling dice and moving around the board, a 'satellite photo' style representation of the TT Races course.  At various points they encounter obstacles that may slow them down or speed them up.  They may land on spaces that cause them to draw Race Situation or Pit Signal cards which can affect their progress positively or negatively.

The game components as listed on the rules card are:

Board (TT Course)
Eight playing pieces of different colours (small plastic motorcycles)
One Throwing/Equipment Holder Box
Two Dice
Once Dice Cup
Six sets of Lap Scoring Cards (each numbered 1 - 6)
Sixty-six Race Situation cards
Sixty-four Pit Signal cards

Name: The National Game of the Star-Spangled Banner
Description: An educational game based on an earlier British game.  One of the first games published in the USA.

Name: Arrivée
Description:
Unpack the whole cycling world on your table! Enter the strategies of the biggest cycling teams in a great family game Arrivée.

Compete in the stages for the jerseys of the best cyclist, World champion, best climber, best sprinter or U-25. 
The game realistically simulates all point and bonus awards of the major cycling races of the world. 
As you ride each stage, time is  measured so that you can know what advantage or loss you have in comparison with your competitors. 
Your journey to victory can become complicated due to sudden weather changes, falls or defects, but team co-operation can help you back to the pack. Refresh your team and have the best performance with the use of a dice, cards and intuitive game mechanism.

Arrivée is the best simulation of cycling race stages in the world!

Name: F.I.L.O
Description:
This is game #6 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series.

F.I.L.O is a sowing game like those in the Mancala family.  Unlike games normally found in the Mancala family, F.I.L.O uses a first in, last out (FILO) mechanism for sowing pieces on the board, which is the basis of its name.  This mechanism, combined with the attributes of the 8x4 board, takes F.I.L.O in directions not normally seen with games in the Mancala family.

Name: Frontjammin'
Description:
This is #7 in the Games on a Half a Checkerboard Series. Frontjammin' is a game like Backgammon, with its own twists.  It also includes a variant using a King piece, which gives the game a bit of a Chess flavor.

In the game, players will roll two dice.  If they roll 5-6 on any of the two dice, that counts as a single die roll that a player picks (1-4).

In addition, the game involves pieces being placed in columns and trapping their opponent's pieces.  The smaller board also lends to an increased chance of a reversal of fortune.

Name: 2-5 Skidoo
Description:
This is game #8 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series.

2-5 Skidoo a press-your-luck game for 2 players on an 8x4 board, in the family of games that includes games like Can't Stop, Cosmic Wimpout, 500, Farkle, Ten Thousand, and Pass the Pigs. The name is derived from the phrase “23 skidoo”.

In this game, each of the 4 columns on the 4x8 board correspond to numbers 2-5.  During a turn a player rolls 6 six-sided dice (numbered 1-6).  They pick three to add up, to beat a target number (this is either zero on their first roll, or what their last total was).  The players then take one of the remaining 3 dice and apply it to one of their columns.

If a player can't apply a die to advance one of their pieces, or don't beat their target number, all advancement resets.

Play continues until a player gets all four of their pieces off the board.

Name: Melting Ice Floes
Description:
This is #9 game in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series.

In Melting Ice Floes, players attempt to eliminate their opponent's pawn or ice floe pieces from the board.  As the game progresses, the board shrinks and players may face a situation where half of the board suddenly disappears on them, leaving them with every increasing dangerous situations from which to escape.  This game comes with variant rules to support 3 and 4 players.

Name: Knight Barricades
Description:
This is game #10 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

This game is in the family of games that includes Amazons, and Slimetrail where the object is to cause one's opponent to not be able to move due to the number of spaces available on the board gets reduced as players play the game.  Each player has a piece that has a move like a Chess Knight and also put down barricades to restrict movement.  From these two elements comes the name of the game.

Name: Shopping, el juego de la moda
Description: The goal of the game is to get ten clothing and fashion items, by answering questions related to the fashion and glamour world. When you annswer correctly, you get money, with which to buy the items you need. After several rounds, the final phase of the game consists in a final question. Depending on how good your item selection was, the answer will be easier or more difficult.

Name: Invocateurs
Description:
In a fantasy world, conflicts are merely a souvenir...
Wars are solved by powerful summoners fighting in a dedicated arena.
Each player incarnate a summoner that will try to defeat its opponents by unleashing powerful creatures to wreck havoc in the rival teams.
Summon creatures, gather magical rings and gain new spells while your opponents are doing the same.
Defeat creatures to increase your experience and improve your abilities.

During his turn, each player can choose two actions (possibly more later in the game) among five (movement, attack, search for a ring, summon, heal).
Moving will allow the player to explore new area of the game, increasing the amount of mana available and making ring search possible, or get closer to enemy's force.
Every aspect of the game is solved with dice (except for summoning creatures).
A player win when he annihilate all the other summoners.

This is a skirmish game blending strategy and chance, with a strong fantasy theme.

Name: Secouris le jeu de cartes
Description:
Really close to happy families or games of trades, the goal is to collect a complete set of cards.

the theme of the game is first aid and families are related to to it (hazardous Products, first aid kit, holiday hazards, ect..)

after asking for a card, you need to answer the question on the card to win it.

The first player to collect a complete set win the game.

Name: Dept. 13
Description:
Dept. 13 is a game in which players use the Steel and Glory System to battle the creatures created by Occult Nazi Forces. Dept. 13 is a secret government agency dedicated to fighting supernatural forces. The game includes super spies (who are identified only by one letter initials), Nazi zombies, ghouls, mad scientists, and themes of occult horror. As with the other games in the S&G system, the battles are very quick and can be fought one-on-one or with players each controlling large groups. Each character has several unique stats, including their fighting ability, and the cost to hire them as a mercenary into your fighting force.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.
Families: Series: Steel and Glory System (Avalon games)

Name: Dept. 13 part 2: Lincoln High
Description: Dept. 13 part 2: Lincoln High is the first expansion to Dept. 13. This expansion adds Gremlins and many new powers to battle against the supernatural Nazi creatures.
Families: Series: Steel and Glory System (Avalon games)

Name: Dept. 13 part 3: Monster Hunters
Description: Dept. 13 part 3: Monster Hunters is the second expansion to Dept. 13. This expansion adds Giant Bugs, Dogs, Army Personnel, and many new powers to battle against the supernatural Nazi creatures.
Families: Series: Steel and Glory System (Avalon games)

Name: Dept. 13 part 4: Armageddon's Dance
Description: Dept. 13 part 4: Armageddon’s Dance is the third expansion to Dept. 13. This expansion provides a set of campaign rules with seven scenarios. It links all other games in the Dept. 13 series together and each is required to play. The results of each scenario are carried forward to the next scenario and can drastically affect the future events. This expansion adds new locations to the game as well, such as a Connecticut Mental Hospital where the Nazis are using the patients for bizarre experiments.
Families: Series: Steel and Glory System (Avalon games)

Name: Steel & Glory 8: Road to Glory
Description: Steel & Glory 8: Road to Glory is the seventh expansion to the Steel and Glory games. This expansion adds mounted units, new terrain, and Squire and Barbarian characters to the game.
Families: Series: Steel and Glory System (Avalon games)

Name: Cave Girl
Description:
Cave Girl takes the S&G combat system to prehistoric times. In this game, a cave girl named Sharr must compete for her existence with dinosaurs. each character in the game comes with several cards designating their fighting abilities which can be used in battle. There are several scenarios included with the game.

Each turn, players activate a character which can take up to two actions, including fight, move, rest, climb, or stand/go prone. Characters can attack enemies that are one square away for melee attack or may use ranged attack for enemies further away. Fighting is based on power of the weapon, power of the character's attack strength, and power of the enemies defense strike. The hit points are calculated via 2D6 - the power of the attack. For example, if an attack had a total strength of 6 and a 10 was rolled, the attack would have a power of 4. Victory is achieved by having a character remain on a certain part of the board for three complete uninterrupted turns.
Families: Series: Steel and Glory System (Avalon games)

Name: Comic Book Heroes 2
Description: Comic Book Heroes 2 is the first expansion to Comic Book Heroes. This expansion comes with a new hero called Night Stalker and a new villain called Brute. There are 18 cards for both which add many new play elements to the base game.

Name: Comic Book Heroes 3
Description: Comic Book Heroes 3 is the second expansion to Comic Book Heroes. This expansion comes with a new hero called Miss America and a new villain called Master Mind. There are 18 cards for both which add many new play elements to the base game.

Name: Comic Book Heroes 4
Description: Comic Book Heroes 4 is the third expansion to Comic Book Heroes. This expansion comes with a new hero called Iron Eagle and a new villain called Doctor Death. There are 18 cards for both which add many new play elements to the base game.

Name: Monster Bash: Psychos and Cosmics
Description: Monster Bash 3: Psychos and Cosmics is the second expansion to Monster Bash: Bloods and Lupines. This expansion adds insane clowns, psychotic children, and other strange creatures to the base game. New scenarios are added that allow the monsters to fight one on one or in large groups. Each monster has a collection of cards that list fight abilities and special powers that are used in battles.
Families: Series: Steel and Glory System (Avalon games)

Name: NHL Big League Manager: Junior Edition
Description:
Among the new features: player cards featuring NHL teams which allow Junior GM's to earn extra points by matching three or five of a kind ( from the same team). This game was also where we first developed the simplified scoring system which we liked so much, we used it for the Platinum Edition. 
Junior General Managers draft players, makes trades and can even grab a free agent from rival General Manager. Finally, the perfect board game for young hockey fans!

The object of the game is to build the strongest team of players best able to win hockey games all while balancing the difficult task of being a general manager. Your team is then pitted against your opponents. The winner of 5 games wins the game.

Name: NHL Breakaway
Description:
NHL Breakaway is a new and exciting action packed 2 player strategy card game. You and your opponent draw from the deck of cards placed between you. When you go to draw cards from the pile, you will draw Player Cards (they represent the players on your team), Instant Replay Cards (intangibles which
may momentarily affect a player or team’s performance) or Slapshot Cards (cards that have a more permanent effect on your team and the overall game).
With the help of your Player Cards and your other cards, try to win Possession of the puck during the face-off and then to go on the Attack to score more goals than your opponent over the course of 3 periods of play.

Name: NHL Slapshot: Western Conference Pack
Description:
Expansion for the NHL Slapshot Card Game 
Adding new carddeck with players from Western Conference.

Name: NHL Slapshot: Eastern Conference Pack
Description:
Expansion for the NHL Slapshot Card Game 
Adding new carddeck with players from Eastern Conference.

Name: SOS Jungle
Description:
Progressive game with a favourite theme, where children help baby animals find their parents in a jungle with look-alike paths riddled with obstacles. 
Games begins with the closed board. Players roll 2 dice (number die and color die) and move on the board, open the tokens if it match with color die until they are able to go through the whole jungle and bring the lost baby animals safely to their mothers!

Contents:

     1 colourful game board 
     2 big foam dice, 
     35 tokens, 
     6 large wooden markers

Name: TROLLBURGER
Description:
The players are gnomes in the employ of a troll on a burger restaurant. The troll told them: "One of you will be fired at the end of the day; the one with worst cash!". The troll will take the customer’s orders and he hope the gnomes make their work fast, very fast; because if they delay an order, the customer (another troll, usually!) will get angry and leave the restaurant without paying.

GAME COMPONENTS

15 order cards
95 product cards
12 counters: 3 green, 3 blue, 3 yellow and 3 red
Rules

GAME PLAY

"Trollburger" is a 2-player card game. At the start of the turn, the starting player turn over the top deck card and show the number on it.

If that number is equal or higher thant the number of order cards on table, another order card is drawn and placed on the table.

Then the starting player choose to perform one of 4 actions on his turn. He can make that action as many times as the number shown at the start of the turn:

-Take cards from the product deck
   -Search a card from the product deck
   -Discard cards from the hand
   -Place products on the table to build a burger

Then, he can choose to deliver a burger to the customers. The player can deliver an incomplete burger, in the hope that the customer does not realize.

Next, the other player takes his turn, using the same number; 
and at last he becomes the starting player for the next turn.

If at any time, a 5th order has to be added on tha table, the older order on table is discarded (and any player who was working on it, loses his product cards).

GOAL

When a player devilers an order he takes that order card. 
The game ends if 4 orders are discarded or the last order card is drawn.
At the end of the game, each player add the victory points of his order cards. The player with more victory points is the winner.

(Here you can find all the files to print & play your own Trollburger).


Los jugadores son gnomos que trabajan para un troll en una hamburgueseria. El troll les ha comunicado que uno de ellos sera despedido al final del dia; aquel que aporte menos al negocio. El troll es el encargado de coger los pedidos de los clientes y espera que los gnomos hagan su trabajo rapido, muy rapido; pues si se retrasan en entregar un pedido, el cliente (normalmente otro troll!!) se va a enfadar y se ira del restaurante si haber consumido.COMPONENTES DEL JUEGO

15 cartas de pedidos
95 cartas de productos
12 contadores: 3 verdes, 3 azules, 3 amarillos y 3 rojos
Reglas

EL JUEGO

"Trollburger" es un juego de cartas para 2 jugadores. Al principio del turno, el jugador inicial gira la carta superior de la baraja y muestra el número que aparece en ella.

Si ese numero es igual o mayor que el numero de cartas de pedidos en la mesa, aparece una nueva carta de pedido y se añade al centro de la mesa.

Después el jugador inicial elige cual de 4 posibles acciones quiere realizar en su turno. Podra hacer esa accion tantas veces como el numero que se ha mostrado al principio del turno:

-Coger cartas de la baraja de productos
   -Buscar una carta en la baraja de productos
   -Descartar cartas de la mano
   -Colocar productos en la mesa para elaborar una hamburguesa

Despues, puede elegir entregar una hamburguesa a los clientes. El jugador puede entregar una hamburguesa que no este acabada, con la esperanza de que el cliente no se de cuenta.

Acto seguido, el otro jugador realiza su turno, usando el mismo numero; y al final se convierte en el jugador inicial para el siguiente turno.

Si en algun momento, se debe anadir un 5º pedido a la mesa, el pedido mas antiguo que hubiera en la mesa se descarta (y cualquier jugador que estuviera elaborando ese bocata, pierde los productos que tuviera en la mesa).

OBJETIVO

Cuando un jugador entrega un pedido se queda esa carta de pedido.
El juego finaliza si 4 pedidos se han descartado o si se muestra el ultimo pedido del mazo.
Al final de la partida, cada jugador suma los puntos de victoria de sus cartas de pedidos. El jugador con mas puntos de victoria es el ganador.

(Aqui puedes encontrar todos los archivos necesarios para imprimir y jugar a tu propio Trollburger)

Name: Freedom
Description:
Freedom is a two-player abstract strategy board game invented by Veljko Cirovic and Nebojsa Sankovic in 2010. It is played with black and white stones on a square board. The game is related to Go-Moku and Slimetrail. It can be played with a Go set or with pen and paper.

Rules:

Board: Freedom is played on a 10×10 square board. Beginners can try the game on a 8×8 board. Other board sizes may be also used.

Objective: The objective of Freedom is to have more "live" stones at the end of the game, than your opponent. A stone is considered to be "live" if it is a part of some horizontal, vertical or diagonal row of exactly 4 stones of the same color.

Play: A game begins with an empty board. Each player has an allocated color: White and Black. White plays first, putting one white stone anywhere on the board. After this move players take turns placing their stones on empty cells adjacent to the last opponent's stone. If all cells adjacent to the last opponent's stone are occupied then the player gets the right ("freedom") to place his stone on any empty cell of the board. The game ends when the board is filled with stones. The last player has the right to pass on his last turn (and leave the last cell empty) if placing his stone reduces his score.

Name: Super Głowa
Description:
Super GÅ‚owa is a Polish crossword game, not unlike Scrabble, in which words are formed on the board with the use of tiles; these words are awarded points with a special bonus system. The difficulty and intellectual level of this game depends on the players.

This game is targeted at both adults, who will find it an interesting way of spending their free time with their friends and families, and children, for whom it will be both a fun game and a learning opportunity. This game aids the development of intelligence, vocabulary and spelling skills.

Components:
- four wooden tile holders
- one thick cardboard board
- 126 cardboard square letter tiles (Polish characters included)
- 2 blank tiles

Name: Colgate Crusaders
Description:
Colgate Crusaders is a children's roll and move game published by the company Colgate Palmolive Ltd. in 1983.  It was not available for general purchase in stores but rather was obtainable by sending off for it to the company.

The game is a promotional piece designed to advertise the benefits of Colgate toothpaste and encourage good dental hygiene amongst children.  It encourages regular brushing and general use of Colgate products and warns against the dangers of too much sugar, fizzy drinks, etc.

The game is set in the fictional Molar System where the players (each playing as one of the game's heroes; Captain Colgate, Blue Minty Kid, Flick Flouride and Mike Molar) are trying to protect the system by keeping it clear of evil villains.  They are constantly on patrol battling against the forces of darkness - Sugary Sam, Sweetie Pie, the Gumboot Boys and the Enamel Animal with his servants the Plaque Monsters.

The aim of the game is to be the first to capture 3 Plaque Monsters and return them to your space ship.

Name: A First Class Murder
Description:
Flossie Carrington had it all - she was young and beautiful, she was the heiress to an American steel empire, and she was married to a handsome ex-Guards officer. But last Thursday, the nation was shocked by the discovery of her body, stuffed under the seat of a first-class compartment on the Plymouth Express. She had been stabbed to death and her fabulously expensive jewels were stolen.

Flossie's father promptly called in Hercule Poirot to investigate. And now he has summoned all those concerned with the case to reveal what really happened that fateful afternoon. One - or more - of you around this table is a murderer. And your task is to discover who that is.

This is the new edition of A First Class Murder, with a new plot and new characters, based on a couple of Agatha Christie's mysteries.

Name: Claustrophobia: De Profundis
Description:
Claustrophobia: De Profundis is an expansion for Croc's Claustrophobia that adds more components and more choices to the game without adding many new rules.

New components include a 52-card deck with new talents for the Brother Redeemer, new demons, new events, new objects; ten new room tiles, with six new types of rooms (sanctified zone, demon pit, tomb of the ancient warrior); four painted figures and additional markers; and twelve new scenarios with playtimes ranging from 30 to 90 minutes.

As for new rules, the demon player's hand size is reduced to three (due to powerful new event cards), Siccaria skills are now permanent, and a new beast is introduced.

Name: Kung Fu U 2
Description: Kung Fu U 2 is an expansion to Kung Fu U. Players use fighting cards to battle each other in Kung Fu matches. This expansion adds several new fight moves, defense techniques, opponent holds, and special attacks. New characters are added as well which are fully compatible with the characters in the first game.

Name: Runes 2
Description: Runes 2 is an expansion to Runes, which allows for two additional players to join in the game and adds new magic spells and characters to the game. Each expansion in the Runes series can be played at the same time to allow up to eight people to play the game at once. This expansion requires the rules and components from the first game in the series. Runes 2 adds the Magical Schools of Necromancy and Elemental Earth to the game.

Name: Runes 3
Description: Runes 3 is an expansion to Runes, which allows for two additional players to join in the game and adds new magic spells and characters to the game. Each expansion in the Runes series can be played at the same time to allow up to eight people to play the game at once. This expansion requires the rules and components from the first game in the series. Runes 3 adds the Magical Fields of Conjuration and Elemental Air to the game.

Name: Runes 4
Description: Runes 4 is an expansion to Runes, which allows for two additional players to join in the game and adds new magic spells and characters to the game. Each expansion in the Runes series can be played at the same time to allow up to eight people to play the game at once. This expansion requires the rules and components from the first game in the series. Runes 4 adds the Magical Fields of Wizardry and Elemental Fire to the game.

Name: Runes 5: Mystic Items
Description: Runes 5: Mystic Items is an expansion to Runes, which adds cards to the game which modify the battle system. The expansion comes with 30 cards, each depicting a magic item, armor, or weapons which the players must purchase to use. Each expansion in the Runes series can be played at the same time to allow up to eight people to play the game at once. This expansion requires the rules and components from the first game in the series. Runes 5 is the only expansion to not offer new characters or spells, instead featuring only the Mystic Item Cards.

Name: Yakitori
Description:
Ever dreamt about being a yakitori chef? Serving up meat and veg skewered, Japanese-style, onto sticks? Grilling on the open flames and hot coals while the sweat drips down the back of your neck and the customers get more and more merry? No? Well now’s your chance to give it a go anyway. Maybe playing “Yakitori” will be the first step on a life changing career change!

Yakitori is a card game for 2-4 players. The aim of the game is to gather the ingredients to put together sticks of meat and veg before cooking them and serving them up to customers. Each customer wants something different – from quail eggs to beef, from asparagus to chicken, carefully seasoned with salt or sweet dark “tare” sauce.

Name: Paperclip Railways: Great Forest
Description:
Bonus station card. Base game has three 'placeholder' station cards that can be cashed in for a promo of choice 'from the box'.

It was published at publisher Facebook profile.

Name: Piktee
Description:
A set collecting game. Cards are traded noisily until one player has at least five of one team. The first to do so cries "Piktee" and scores 50 points and claims the Free Kick card, and a new deal starts (the Free Kick card has no purpose at all so I do not know why it was included in the game).
If a player dares, he may not call out his 5 card team but he can wait to get a six card team. If he is still the first to call "Piktee" he will score double points but, of course, by waiting, someone else might call a team before him and he will not score.
The Penalty card is exactly that, a penalty card. If you are caught with it in your hand when "Piktee" is called, you lose 25 points.
The first player to score 500 points after several deals, wins.

Name: From the Cellar: Pack 6
Description:
Ten Scenarios for ASL that are quite short. All Scenarios are presented in full color (even the map depiction).

The Scenarios included are:
Close Encounter of the Bad Kind [FT160]
French Civil War in Gabon [FT161]
Assault on District Rovno [FT162]
Price of Persia [FT163]
Guts are Not Enough [FT164]
Shopino Struggle [FT165]
Heroes at Leros [FT166]
Wasp Sting [FT167]
By Dawn's Early Light [FT168]
Daring Parafroggers [FT169]

Name: From the Cellar: Pack 5
Description:
This FTC pack for ASL comes with 14 scenarios, 2 articles and the corrected version of map LFT II.

The 14 Scenarios in this pack:
Bridge of Life [FT146]
Flight of the Intruders [FT147]
La Horgne [FT148]
Tombés pour la France [FT149]
Storm over Champagne [FT150]
Get Them Out! [FT151]
Avanti! [FT152]
Nailed to the Ground [FT153]
First Defeat [FT154]
Once upon a Time... in the East [FT155]
Leonov's Hill [FT156]
The Lost Column [FT157]
Close Combat Teams [FT158]
Tangled at Tsangkou [FT159]

Name: Blulu
Description:
An arithmetically paired fishing game with the Decktet.

In the Eastern Deserts, the jackrabbits are regarded as a pest and a delicacy. Lesser known is that between eating (and being eaten) they while away their time with a simple fishing game.

As a fishing game, the goal of the game is to capture cards. Each player will play two cards every turn, capturing cards using either the sum or difference of the played cards. The players that captures the most cards scores points for the round. The first player to reach twenty-two points wins the game and is granted the privilege to be the first bunny out for dinner.

The game is a reinvention of the classic Moroccan fishing game Ronda.  Aside from using the Decktet instead of the Latin Deck, the game is also played with two cards at a time and bonuses are given for suit combinations played.

Name: Pepper. Corn!
Description:
A feeding frenzy for two bunnies.

This is a simple fishing game of capturing cards off the tableau. The game starts with an 8x3 grid of cards face up on the table.  After splitting the undealt cards (using a split the pie mechanism) the players capture cards by playing one or more cards whose rank adds up equal or higher than the card being captured.  Each of the capturing cards must share a suit with the card being taken. After the tableau is cleared, the players add up the values of their captured cards to determine the winner.

Even though the game was designed as a light game, it is almost completely a perfect information game.  The only moment where there is not perfect information is when the players determine the split of the hand -- and even then they can figure out which cards the opponent is splitting.  As such it could be played as a very memory heavy, intense, spatial game.

The game was inspired by the designer's pet rabbit who is by far the most enthusiastic and fastest eating bunny the designer has ever seen. The girl has no problems yanking food right out of her partner's mouth, but is readily aggrieved if she does not get her fair share of the produce.

Name: The Ides of March
Description:
The Ides of March is a small game about the assassination of Julius Caesar. The premise is that Mark Anthony appears on the scene armed with a sword, albeit some distance from the scene. He has to either kill all the conspirators or get Caesar off the map before he is killed. Since he has a sword, he does considerably more damage with his attacks than the conspirators (armed with daggers) can manage.

The game contains rules, combat results table, map, and 10 counters, all printed on a single sheet of paper.

Name: The Battle of Austerlitz. 2nd December 1805
Description:
First in a series of Hex and Counter war games at Battalion level covering the Napoleonic Era.

Austerlitz is fought over a number of A3 boards (3 for Austerlitz). Counters represent the major units of Infantry,Cavalry, and Artillery units that fought the battle.

Movement is conducted at both Grand Tactical Level ( Some units may move more than others) and Tactical Level depending on the Battle fought. Here, movement is dealt at the Tactical Level only with four phases being Move,Fire,Melee,and Resolution.The Grand Tactical Level is merely the turn record of the battle which lasts 24 turns from 0600 hours to 1800 hours.

Battles are fought at both a Fire and Melee stage, Fire being those units firing which are in range of the enemy by using a dice + fire add on factors - Defensive attributes to achieve a final score. If the score is equal or greater the the units vulnerability score (7), units are placed face down and rendered non-operational.

In the melee stage, those units which did not fire in the Fire tactical stage may now battle and use one dice + Melee add on factor to achieve a final score. If the final score is greater than 6 against a non-operational unit, then that unit is destroyed.

Victory is decided by the player with the  most units left after 24 turns.

Name: World Record Buck
Description:
From the rules:
Welcome to the world of the furtive whitetail buck! Considered by veteran hunters to be one of the most challenging big game species on our continent, he is an amazingly adaptable animal, inhabiting regions from the fringes of our cities to remote wilderness.

Join fellow hunters in the stimulating, educational, sometimes frustrating, but always exciting chase as the whitetail seeks to elude you on his own turf.

WORLD RECORD BUCK is more than just a great game. It is a fine training tool for the young or future hunter, and serves as a reminder to us 'old timers' as well as we prepare for the next season. This game will help you get it all together! And who knows? The taker of the next 'World Record Buck' just may be you!


 In this game, players play both a hunter and a deer, trying to stalk the deer belonging to other players while moving their own deer away from any hunters. First player to bag two deer win the game.

Name: Fifes & Drums
Description:
A two-player game for the Decktet:

It is the last battle in the final campaign of a mad but brilliant general. Six companies of tired soldiers are all that stands between him and the advancing enemy. He doesn't realize it yet, but there is no way for him to win.

Fortunately, you are not playing the general in this game. Unfortunately, you're not the advancing army either.

Instead, you play a member of the general's staff. You were offered money by captains of a few of the remaining companies. Maneuver them off the field before the inevitable defeat, and they will pay you handsomely. So cue the fifes and drums! Jigger the retreat orders to put your cronies as far from danger as possible.

Of course, everybody else on the general's staff was bribed to put their cronies ahead of yours.

The game is played on a track, with the companies represented by six tokens corresponding to each of the Decktet suits. Each player starts with a secret goal card, telling them which units they want to have do well. Each turn, players draft from a pool of cards, moving the units that correspond to their card's suit a total distance corresponding to their card's rank.

Name: Regnum Potestas Gloria
Description:
In Regnum+Potestas+Gloria, a fledgling kingdom emerges from the chaos of Europe’s Dark Ages. As a great house in this kingdom, you must work with – and against – your fellow houses to bring stability, order, and progress to a struggling land.

You will use loyal Retainers from your court to secure your fiefs and gather Labor – one of the five types of Power you can earn and spend. As you develop and grow, you will find it advantageous to grant land to Monks, Knights, and Merchants, each of whom earns you a different type of Power. This also frees up Retainers so they can be used to take more actions on the game’s various boards.

These boards reflect the kingdom’s customs – its political, religious, economic, and feudal structures. Each custom offers the players a unique set of actions, and some include Offices - positions of influence that grant their holders bonus Power as well as access to exclusive actions. Just as important, each custom dictates the types of Power valued by society; houses that produce the right kinds of Power will gain more Glory, and will ultimately win the game.

In addition to paying for actions, Power can be used to change the customs themselves, opening up new actions and offices, and altering the types of Power that will lead to victory. Players must therefore either adapt to new customs, or work to ensure that the existing customs remain in place. As you navigate your way to greatness and victory, you will find yourself arranging marriages, earning titles, erecting grand structures, and fighting alongside your fellow Houses as foreign nations invade the kingdom, but in the end only one house will be celebrated in the history books. That house must, by rights, be yours…

Name: Mini-Quiz
Description: A simple trivia game for 2-12 players. Those have to answer questions of 4 different topics: "Tales and Legends", "Sports and Games", "Nature and Environment" and "General". If the answer is right the players token goes one step forward on the board. The player first reaching the finish line wins the game.

Name: Kyogami
Description:
Kyogami is a simple roll and move game, primarily educational.
The game mechanism is deliberately simple and the game focuses on the Kyoto Protocol.

Players are manufacturers, they manage and buy factories, trying to reduce their carbon emission levels and they trade some Carbon "quotas".

Name: Darn!
Description:
Darn! is an abstract, tactical, card playing, dice rolling board game taking place on three different areas.
On the playing board players move their pawns from field to field, try to collect tokens and to be the first to enter the goal field.
The dice pool contains a number of dice with positive and negative numbers. Players may choose dice from the dice pool when making moves.
Cards are played to perform moves, manipulate the dice or modify the way the dice are used.

Name: Football Fanatic
Description:
Players watch a game of American football on TV, and use cards to try to score points based on the plays made in the actual game.

[i]From the rule card:[/i]
Football Fanatic is an interactive football party that is played by two or more players.  The limit to the number of players depends on availability of cards.  There are 39 cards in the standard football Fanatic game allowing for 39 players.  Get more cards for more players.

Name: Wall Street
Description:
The game was developed with the aid of stock exchange brokers. The target audience are those people who want to have an easy introduction on the way the stock exchange works.

The aim of the game is to make your starting capital grow by buying stocks and gold. The worth of the stock fluctuates throughout the game, and the aim is to buy/sell stock at the most opportune time.
Rules also include Tender offers and Holdings.

Winner is the player with the highest worth of stock and gold.

Name: Dwyn
Description:
A card game containing 6 different welsh characters broken up into a head, a torso, and feet.  Players attempt for form a complete character, and then empty their hands except for the crown card (which is unique in the deck).  Most cards in the deck allow you to swap or steal body parts from other players, creating mixed-up characters as the game proceeds.

[i]From the Rules:[/i]
Each player tries to form a BODY consisting of three cards - HEAD, TORSO and FEET - either of different suits (good) or the same suit (best). In order to win, a player must form a BODY and get rid of all the cards in their hand, going out of play with only body parts in front of them with at least one each of a HEAD, TORSO and FEET and the KROWN card, with no other cards in their hand.

[i]From the Box:[/i]
Whats Dwyn?
A game with lots of card swapping.  A six suited poker deck divided into three colors, red, black and green with figures drawn from welsh history and popular culture.  A fun new artwork by Simon Frennan and Christopher Sperandio. The result of an artists residency as part of the may-you-live-in-interesting-times festival of creative technology.  The residency is findancially supported by Cywaith Cymru.  Get rules for new games, and play an online version, just go to chapter.org or kartoonkings.com/dwyn.

Beth yw Dwyn?
Gem fywiog yn llawn o gyfnewid cardiau. Pecyn o gardiau mewn chew siwt wedi'u rhannu'n dri lliw, coch, du a gwyrdd, ynghyd a ffigyrau o hanes a diwylliant poblogiadd cymru.  Gwaith celfyddydol hwyliog, newydd gan Simon Grennan a Christopher Sperandio.  Canlyniad cyfnod preswyl yng MAY YOU LIVE IN INTERESTING TIMES, gyl technoleg greadigol caerdydd, a drefnwyd gan chapter a bloc.  Carfwyd cefnogaeth ariannol i'r cyfnod preswyl gan cywaith cymru. I weld rheolau'r gem, ac i chwarae fersiwn ar-lien, ewch i chapter.org neu kartoonkings.com/dwyn.

Name: Witty Zibi
Description:
before each round, players take a team token and keep it hidden.
players can be distributed randomly in 2 or 3 teams, without knowing who are their team mates

During the rounds players fight each other using bananas cards to inflict damages. some other cards have special power like "healing", "counter" or "identification" (reveal the team token of the taget player).
When a player takes 110 damages, he is dead for the round and reveal his team token.
The round ends when the last player of a team is eliminated.
Players earns points depending of their teams and if they are alive or not.
Then another round begin...

The player with the highest score at the end win the game.

Name: SCHEELSopoly
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

A Monopoly style game featuring the Scheels sporting goods company.

Name: Let's Rodeo
Description:
Let's Rodeo is a game for people to enjoy the sport of rodeo anyplace, anytime.  This game is designed to show how one rodeos, starting from the amateur right up to the pro circuit and through to the finals.

Players roll a die and move around the game board, which consists of two circuits, amateur and pro. All players start by moving around the amateur circuit. Players enter rodeos by landing on a rodeo square and paying the entry fee. A card is then drawn which gives the player's result in the rodeo and money is awarded. Each rodeo can be entered multiple times.  There are places on the board where players must pay money and some where broke players can earn money. Filling a "permit" (earning a set amount of money) is necessary to move into the pro circuit.

Once in the pro circuit each player must enter and place in each of the 8 pro rodeos.  Each rodeo can only be entered once. Once any player has completed all 8 pro rodeos the finals begin.  Any players still on the amateur circuit are eliminated. All players on the pro circuit roll dice to find out their standings in the final events.  Winnings in the finals are added to money earned in the pro circuit and the winner is the player with the most money.

Name: Counter: Real Time Miniature Combat
Description:
Counter is a miniature game that lets you assemble a squad of troops that meets your requirements and then pit them against your opponents in real time.
Played in 30 second rounds, players race their miniatures over the contested hot-spots of the battle field while targeting and throwing out cover fire as best they can.

But speed and reflex must be tempered with strategy and patience.
Expend more resources than your opponents and they will get the drop on you.

But perhaps your squad has an ace or two up it's sleeve?
Did you bring more gunners than your opponent to likely win any fire fight? Or perhaps you opted to bring Heavies to devastate the battlefield and control the field of play? Or maybe you decided to unleash the kind of tactics and tricks that only your Ops can bring to a squad?

In any case, the battle will be fast a vicious, and leave you with plenty to consider and tinker with before the next battle begins.

---

Game play for Counter consists of 30 second rounds of frantic live action troop maneuvers performed by all players simultaneously.
Strategy and nerve must be used to lay out your action chips on the zones marked out in the battle field, as their placement will allow for different actions to take place:
- place them down in a zone and you can then move a troop on top of them, provided you can get him there fast enough
- place your chip on top of another players chip to lay down cover fire, preventing an enemy entering that zone.
- use your chips to target the troops in a zone, then get your troops in range to finish them off.
- reserve your chips to build up your intuitive and get the drop on other combatants, firing before they do. 
All of these actions and more take place fluidly, and then the action resolves in a snap when the timer chimes, then in a flash it continues on in subsequent rounds until the battle field is secured or left devastated.

The dynamic real time action system along with team construction and the various orders and tactics that players can field with Op cards ensures every game of Counter will demand thought and instinct of a high caliber from all players.
